title: No, Congress Has Not Promised Rs 72,000 Per Month to Poor Families
subtitle: A Facebook post has gone viral on Wednesday, 27 March, which says that in 2014, the Congress did not have money to buy weapons for the Armed Forces, but now, in 2019, they are making promises about giving Rs 72,000 per month.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
The post makes two claims. The first is that the Congress government had no money to procure weapons for the Armed Forces in 2014.

This part of the post is true.

In February 2014, when the UPA government was in power, the then defence minister AK Anthony had said that his ministry had used up 92 percent of the defence budget and major acquisitions may have to wait till the next fiscal year.

“There is no money left. All major projects have to wait till 1 April,” Antony said, reported The Indian Express.

This was one reason why India was not able to sign a $20 billion deal to acquire Rafale jets at that time. The decision to buy 126 Rafale jets had been taken in January 2012.

Talking about the medium multi-role combat aircraft (MMRCA) deal, the defence minister said there was a “delay” but “negotiations are going on, because of shortage of funds, the deal will finalise in the next financial year”, according to the report.
